marketNews.title: Oil, Gold, and CPO Prices Collectively Increase
marketNews.content: The prices of several commodities have increased in recent days. Oil and gold increased in Monday (6/2) night trading, while crude palm oil (CPO) increased in Tuesday (6/3) trading. Here is a summary of news regarding the price movements of these three commodities: Oil Brent crude futures for August 2025 delivery closed up +2.4% at 63.9 US dollars per barrel on Monday (6/2) followed by a +1.2% increase to 64.7 US dollars per barrel on Tuesday (6/3). This price increase responded to two developments: 1) the OPEC+ decision to maintain stable production increases and 2) the decline in the number of rigs in the US and supply disruptions in Canada. OPEC+ on Saturday (5/31) decided to maintain the July 2025 production increase of 411,000 barrels per day. This is the third consecutive month where OPEC+ is increasing production by the same amount, thus easing market expectations for a more aggressive increase. Furthermore, the US reported that the number of rigs continued to decline throughout May 2025, reaching its lowest level since 2021. On the other hand, Reuters estimated that 7% of oil production in Canada was impacted by forest fires in Alberta province. The price of Brent crude itself has decreased by -13.5% YTD as of Tuesday (6/3), mainly driven by OPEC+'s production increase plan which exceeded initial expectations and a decline in demand amidst a weakening global economic growth outlook due to trade wars. Gold Spot gold prices一度rose +3.1% to 3,392 US dollars per troy ounce on Monday (6/2), hitting the highest level in the last three weeks, before falling -0.9% to close at 3,357 US dollars per troy ounce on Tuesday (6/3). This increase occurred along with rising investor concerns about global uncertainty and the weakening of the US Dollar Index (DXY). The US plan to increase steel and aluminum import tariffs from 25% to 50%, plus Ukraine's attack on Russia late last week increased investor concerns. The DXY itself closed down -0.7% at 98.7 in Monday (6/2) trading. Gold prices have increased by +28% YTD as of Tuesday (6/3) and had reached an all time high of 3,500 US dollars per troy ounce last April (4/22). This YTD increase was mainly driven by trade tensions causing investors to shift to safe haven assets. The DXY has weakened by -9.6% YTD as of Tuesday (6/3). CPO CPO futures for August 2025 delivery briefly rose +2.6% to 3,977 ringgit per ton before closing up +1.4% at 3,934 ringgit per ton on Tuesday (6/3). This increase followed the Indian government's decision to cut the basic import tax on crude edible oils from 20% to 10% on Friday (5/30). This policy aims to lower domestic food prices while supporting the local refining industry. With this adjustment, the total import tariff for crude edible oil decreased from 27.5% to 16.5%, considering there are additional levies besides the basic tariff. Meanwhile, the tariff for processed edible oil remained unchanged, widening the tariff gap between crude and processed edible oils, thus encouraging importers to switch to crude oil imports. CPO prices have fallen -13.2% YTD as of Tuesday (6/3), mainly driven by decreased demand from India. India's CPO imports even weakened to their lowest level in 14 years in January 2025.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Kenaikan harga ketiga komoditas ini memberikan sentimen positif bagi emiten-emiten terkait yakni: 1) produsen migas ($MEDC, $ENRG, $RATU); 2) produsen emas ($ANTM, $ARCI, $PSAB, $BRMS) dan 3) produsen CPO ($TAPG, $LSIP, $DSNG).

marketNews.title: Government Rolls Out Second Phase Economic Stimulus Package IDR 24.44 Trillion
marketNews.content: The government officially rolled out the second phase economic stimulus package worth 24.44 trillion rupiah on Monday (6/2). Although this stimulus package does not include a 50% electricity discount, which was canceled due to slow budgeting processes. Instead, the government doubled the nominal amount of wage subsidy assistance from 150 thousand rupiah per month to 300 thousand rupiah per month, which will be given to 17.3 million workers earning below 3.5 million rupiah per month or according to provincial minimum wage, and 565 thousand honorary teachers in June and July 2025. In addition to wage subsidy assistance, here is the second phase economic stimulus package that the government will provide in June-July 2025: 1) 30% train ticket discount, 6% airplane ticket discount through the government-borne VAT policy, and 50% sea ticket discount; 2) 20% toll tariff discount; 3) thickening of social assistance amounting to an additional 200 thousand rupiah per month and 10 kg of rice per month for 18.3 million families receiving the Sembako Card program; 4) 50% work accident insurance premium discount for 2.7 million workers in 6 labor-intensive industries.

marketNews.title: OJK Notes Indonesian Crypto Asset Consumers Increased to 14.16 Million as of April 2025
marketNews.content: OJK recorded that the number of Indonesian crypto asset consumers increased to 14.16 million as of April 2025, up from 13.71 million in March 2025. Transaction value also increased to 35.61 trillion rupiah from the previous 32.45 trillion rupiah. OJK considers this trend reflects strong market confidence despite being colored by volatility risks. Chainalysis notes Indonesia ranks third globally in the number of crypto adopters, supported by positive global sentiment. Indodax CEO, Oscar Darmawan, stated that price momentum is the main driver for the increase in participation.

marketNews.title: OJK Asks Digital Banks to Adjust Deposit Interest Rates
marketNews.content: Head of Banking Supervision OJK, Dian Ediana Rae, stated on Monday (6/2) that OJK asks digital banks to adjust deposit interest rates, especially for time deposits, to remain in line with market conditions and maintain the health of financial ratios such as BOPO and cost of fund. This statement was made amidst tight competition in gathering public funds, as well as the banking sector's slow response to the decrease in BI's benchmark interest rate.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Housing and Settlement Proposes IDR 21.8 Trillion Budget for House Renovations
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Housing and Settlement, Fahri Hamzah, stated on Monday (6/2) that his ministry proposed a budget of 21.8 trillion rupiah from the State Budget (APBN) to renovate 1 million houses for poor families in 2025. Each unit will receive assistance of 21.8 million rupiah, consisting of building material costs, the homeowner's labor, and facilitators. This renovation is part of the 3 million house program, which will continue in 2026 with a renovation target of 2 million units.

marketNews.title: OJK Mandates Co-payment Scheme for Health Insurance Starting January 1, 2026
marketNews.content: OJK mandates a co-payment scheme for health insurance starting January 1, 2026, where policyholders will bear 10% of the claim costs with a certain limit (SEOJK No. 7/2025). An observer from Gadjah Mada University (UGM), Kapler Marpaung, assesses that this policy will burden customers, but it is necessary to suppress claims due to medical inflation.

marketNews.title: Trader Must Know These Order Types!
marketNews.content: "Although it looks like just clicking buy or sell, understanding how to use these order types will make trading more controlled and safe." - Stockbiz8

tickerNews.title: TPIA Subsidiary (CDI) Reportedly Filed for IPO
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Head of Capital Market Supervision, Derivatives Market and Carbon Exchange of the Financial Services Authority, Inarno Djajadi, said that PT Chandra Daya Investasi (CDI), a subsidiary of PT Chandra Asri Pacific, has submitted its IPO registration statement. Inarno stated that OJK is reviewing CDI's registration. Previously, Kontan had received a prospectus showing CDI's plan to issue a maximum of 12.48 billion shares (10% of post-IPO issued and fully paid-up capital) with an initial offering price in the range of 170-190 rupiah per share. Thus, the total IPO funds potentially raised by CDI amount to a maximum of 2.37 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Approves 2024 Dividend Distribution and Board Changes
tickerNews.content: ISAT: Indosat approved the plan for the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution amounting to approximately 2.7 trillion rupiah or 83.8 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~55% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 48%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4% as of Tuesday (6/3). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 11, 2025, while the payment date is July 2, 2025. ISAT shareholders also approved the appointment of Syed Bilal Kazmi as a director of the company, replacing Ritesh Kumar Singh who submitted his resignation letter on May 26, 2025. Furthermore, Nezar Patria - Deputy Minister of Communication and Digital - was appointed as the company's President Commissioner, replacing Halim Alamsyah.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Confirms Spin-off Plan, Plans to Issue IDR 5 Trillion Mudharabah Sukuk
tickerNews.content: BRIS: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, confirmed the spin-off plan for Bank Syariah Indonesia. Erick explained that the plan is still in process, including the possibility of transferring BRIS under the auspices of Danantara. Currently, Bank Mandiri is the majority shareholder of BRIS, followed by Bank Negara Indonesia and Bank Rakyat Indonesia. Separately, BRIS plans this month to issue stage II mudharabah sukuk with a principal value reaching 5 trillion rupiah for new and existing financing distribution. The sukuk consists of Series A (370-day tenor with a 6.45% yield), Series B (2-year tenor with a 6.55% yield), and Series C (3-year tenor with a 6.65% yield). The sukuk has received an idAAA(sy) rating from Pefindo. The public offering period is estimated to run from June 19-23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Shareholders Approve Jumbo Dividend of USD 500 Million and Board Appointments
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Alamtri Resources Indonesia shareholders on Monday (6/2) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution of 500 million US dollars or approximately 8.2 trillion rupiah, implying a final dividend of 159 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 16,300 rupiah per US dollar. This amount is equivalent to a ~36% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~49%) and indicates a final dividend yield of 7.6% as of Tuesday (6/3). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced. Previously, ADRO distributed an interim dividend of 106.8 rupiah per share in January 2025. Furthermore, ADRO shareholders also approved the appointment of Garibaldi 'Boy' Thohir as Vice President Commissioner and Iwan Dewono Budiyuwono as President Director. Boy previously served as President Director of ADRO, while Iwan served as Director.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Shareholders Approve 2024 Final Dividend of IDR 47 per Share
tickerNews.content: UNVR: Unilever Indonesia shareholders on Tuesday (6/3) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution amounting to approximately 3.36 trillion rupiah, reflecting a dividend payout ratio of approximately 100% (vs. 2023: 111%) and a final dividend of 47 rupiah per share. This amount indicates a final dividend yield of 2.8% as of Tuesday (6/3). The recording date is June 17, 2025, while the payment date has not been announced. Previously, UNVR distributed an interim dividend of 41 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Reportedly Weighs Sale of Healthcare Firm AdMedika for at Least USD 100 Million
tickerNews.content: TLKM: Bloomberg reported that Telekomunikasi Indonesia is considering selling Administrasi Medika (AdMedika) for a price of at least 100 million US dollars. Previously, TLKM acquired a 75% stake in AdMedika in 2010 for 128 billion rupiah (approximately 7.9 million US dollars). AdMedika is a company that provides health claim management services and collaborates with more than 7,800 health facilities in Indonesia and several other countries.

tickerNews.title: MTEL Approves 2024 Dividend Distribution and New Commissioners Appointment
tickerNews.content: MTEL: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi approved the plan for the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution amounting to approximately 2.06 trillion rupiah or 25.3 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~98% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 75%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.2% as of Tuesday (6/3). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 11, 2025, while the payment date is July 2, 2025. MTEL shareholders also approved the appointment of Fadli Tri Hartono - Special Staff to the Minister of State Secretary - as the company's President Commissioner, replacing Yusuf Wibisono. Furthermore, Ratu Isyana Bagoes Oka and Faisal Amir Masduki were appointed as company commissioners.

tickerNews.title: SPTO Shareholders Approve 2024 Final Dividend of IDR 35 per Share with 5% Yield
tickerNews.content: SPTO: Surya Pertiwi shareholders on Monday (6/2) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution of 189 billion rupiah, equivalent to a 60% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 53%). This amount indicates a final dividend of 35 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 5% as of Tuesday (6/3). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced. Previously, SPTO distributed an interim dividend of 35 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMIL Procures 1,000 Electric Forklifts for IDR 400-500 Billion Investment
tickerNews.content: SMIL: Sarana Mitra Luas conducted the procurement of 1,000 electric-powered forklifts from Heli Southeast Asia Co., Ltd, with an estimated investment value reaching 400-500 billion rupiah. SMIL's President Director, Hadi Suhermin, stated that the company targets 75% of its forklift fleet to use electric power in the next 5 years. This strategy is expected to increase the company's margins and support the 2025 revenue target of 420 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DAAZ Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Distribution of Approximately IDR 250 Billion
tickerNews.content: DAAZ: Daaz Bara Lestari shareholders on Wednesday (5/28) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution of approximately 250 billion rupiah, equivalent to a ~55% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~54%). This amount indicates a dividend of 125 rupiah per share and a dividend yield of 3% as of Tuesday (6/3). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 11, 2025, while the payment date is July 3, 2025.
